pr_title: Add null annotations to providers and ThingManager

timeline.message:
Add null annotations to providers and ThingManager

Signed-off-by: Wouter Born <github@maindrain.net>

timeline.bodyText:
It seems that @NonNullByDefault is not applied to generic type parameters. So it would be nice if SAT will not generate warnings for these.
We might also want to test what happens when annotating the generic type parameter in the interface with @NonNull. Maybe adding @Nullable on these types in methods would then override @NonNull?
timeline.author: wborn

replies.bodyText: Have you tried to state that K in general extends a non null object?
replies.author: maggu2810

replies.bodyText: It seems to work and you can also override the annotations at method level. But it has a domino effect so I have to add/fix more annotations to get this working. 😉
replies.author: wborn

replies.bodyText:
Apparently Xtend doesn't support type annotations
https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=506374
So there is no way to satisfy the nullness annotations of the GenericThingProvider causing the compiler to error on this project:

  
    
      openhab-core/bundles/org.openhab.core.model.thing/src/org/openhab/core/model/thing/internal/GenericThingProvider.xtend
    
    
         Line 76
      in
      aae207b
    
    
    
    

        
          
           class GenericThingProvider extends AbstractProvider<Thing> implements ThingProvider, ModelRepositoryChangeListener, ReadyService.ReadyTracker { 
        
    
  


For now I've reconfigured the compiler to only log warnings for such issues on this project.
replies.author: wborn

timeline.bodyText:
There are 57 classes defined as "public final class".
If they cannot be easily mocked in tests, it will either result in custom build Mocks or less tests.
timeline.author: wborn

replies.bodyText: I think the root cause with this particular case is that the class doesn't implement an interface which would otherwise be perfectly mockable. 😉
replies.author: wborn

timeline.bodyText:
I always use this trick to force the auto formatter to start the next item on a new line. 😉
That way you don't have to use formatter:on/off for this particular case.
timeline.author: wborn

timeline.message:
Use @NonNull with generic type parameters

Signed-off-by: Wouter Born <github@maindrain.net>

Cast to ThingRegistryImpl as before

Signed-off-by: Wouter Born <github@maindrain.net>

timeline.author: cweitkamp
cweitkamp

replies.author: wborn

timeline.author: cweitkamp
cweitkamp

replies.bodyText:
It's an overridden method from a Gson class which isn't annotated. It's not null but if you add @NonNull or don't annotate the compiler errors:
Illegal redefinition of parameter type, inherited method from InstanceCreator<ManagedItemProvider.PersistedItem> does not constrain this parameter
Adding @Nullable works but isn't correct. Adding @NonNullByDefault({}) makes the compiler happy too. The best way would of course be resolving this using  EEAs (#888).
replies.author: wborn

timeline.author: cweitkamp

replies.bodyText: I might do a PR to improve this everywhere in the code base. 😉
replies.author: wborn

timeline.message:
Prevent NPEs by calling equals on non-null constants
